text: <@U0KM61BCP> <@U0PB67X4K> <@U0ULK2JPP> I wanted to talk about the state of v0.6
i've been told there are no plans for a post v0.6.1 update (e.g. v0.6.2) but yet there are more commits on the branch
I could actually use the FAB-860 fix in my work
whats the plan?
<@U0KN2SSKE> ^^^
should we consider cutting v0.6.2, or should I just carry the FAB-860 patch locally?
its not a huge deal to carry the patch, but it is odd to have patches with no intention of using them :wink:
The commits should be either docs or tests, I think
some of the changes were just doc changes which get picked up without needed to put out a new release
not sure we need a release
<@U0KN2SSKE>: ?
the fix for FAB-860 did get merged in case someone actually ever needed it
from an optics perspective, I'd prefer not to put out another release unless there is high demand for some fix  (but you've all heard that from me before)
I can work from the branch, its just odd
<@U0KM61BCP> FWIW, I am referring to this patch: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/commit/99a666935df0c96e01b397d06bf009b25bb4e9f2>

attachments.title: FAB-860 Fix table crash · hyperledger/fabric@99a6669 · GitHub
attachments.text: GetRows exibits two kinds of errors . iterator gets closed asynchronously while chaincode is traversing rows . channel panic on iterator getting closed (this happens when chaincode does...
attachments.fallback: GitHub: FAB-860 Fix table crash · hyperledger/fabric@99a6669

text: this was committed to v0.6 post v0.6.1 tag
(and there are others that look like real patches, not just doc updates
yeah - murali fixed it
oh wait, nm
the other patches sounded like code changes, but were just doc
ok, so maybe this is the only one
so, ill leave it at this: the code is def broken without the FAB-860 fix (at least for my use case)
im confirming now whether the FAB-860 fix addresses the concern...ill report back, and someone can decide if its worth a release or not
well if you try to return more than 100 rows you are definitely screwed  :wink:
without the patch, yes
we had been working with a previous version of the FAB-860 patch that fixed it...im confirming that the official fix does the same
ok, maybe a 0.6.2 is in order
+1 for that… tho the release maybe sparse, the GetRows issue has had enough complaints to warrant to be added to a release I think
it will take me a little while to confirm, there was a bunch of other stuff I had to upgrade to get to v0.6
<@U0ULK2JPP> <@U0KM61BCP> <@U0PB67X4K> I did confirm that the fix works
<@U0KN2SSKE>
(thank you, <@U0ULK2JPP> )

well, in the test I just ran, 5010 rows
but that is variable
ok
thanks...
I know it used to blow up with barely any before
so, id say its generally fixed based on intuition, even though I have yet to run through a regression matrix
also, considering the source's author :wink:
well, couldnt find a good reaction for that so will just say :pray: :slightly_smiling_face:
shall I propose a v0.6.2 release CR to further the discussion?
Not a bad idea (if you ask me). If we could have a window to squeeze in some more stuff, we could add a few things there.

ty
